title: T206 Ty Cobb Red background Lenox back
author: Bigb13

posts.post_title: T206 Ty Cobb Red background Lenox back
posts.post_content: Listening to offers on my T206 Ty Cobb Red background with a Lenox back[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=182807&d=1426366647[/IMG]
All I can say is WOW.  That is an amazing card!

Robert,

Cool card with a Lenox back that you don't see very often......and actually, you don't see it in your ad either ! :) Please post the back pic of this beauty and please PM me a ballpark on this card. Thanks, Mike
PM sent, thanks...

Kevin, I thought you only collected high grade cards? ;)

Big- PM sent
[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=182854&d=1426390786[/IMG]
Here's a picture of the back
Still available very rare. Email offers

[quote name="Bigb13" post=1391991]Still available very rare. Email offers[/QUOTE]

if you put a price it may be easier to sell the card but up to you
I have taken this card to several card shows and showed it to a dozen or so people and auction houses and they estimated it at 25-35k. Rob

[quote name="Bigb13" post=1392102]I have taken this card to several card shows and showed it to a dozen or so people and auction houses and they estimated it at 25-35k. Rob[/QUOTE]

people may think you are asking for 25k I guess...your call...

[quote name="Bigb13" post=1392102]I have taken this card to several card shows and showed it to a dozen or so people and auction houses and they estimated it at 25-35k. Rob[/QUOTE]

Rob, if they think the card is worth 25-35K, have any of them offered to buy it from you for that amount?
I think he missed a decimal
I posted that I was listening to offers if someone offers something I can live with than ok but everyone wants a price.

[quote name="Bigb13" post=1392148]I posted that I was listening to offers if someone offers something I can live with than ok but everyone wants a price.[/QUOTE]

I find that with expensive cards, people don't usually like to bid against themselves and need a price.
Any interest in trading for drastic miscuts?
Think I will go the auction way
Lol Rob

[quote name="Bigb13" post=1392168]Think I will go the auction way[/QUOTE]

let everyone know where you send it....we can 'out' the card so people know about it so it doesn't go cheap
Thanks

[quote name="calvindog" post=1392152]I find that with expensive cards, people don't usually like to bid against themselves and need a price.[/QUOTE]

I had submitted a private offer well within the reasonable range for this card before it was posted publicly and was spammed 50 times. Told him I wouldn't be interested if it was posted publicly.

I believe he killed his own market by spamming pictures of it everywhere.

[quote name="Sean1125" post=1392209]I had submitted a private offer well within the reasonable range for this card before it was posted publicly and was spammed 50 times. Told him I wouldn't be interested if it was posted publicly.

I believe he killed his own market by spamming pictures of it everywhere.[/QUOTE]

what you mean spammed 50 times....they sent out your offer?

you don't have to say your offer but whats the range you think this card would sell for at auction
I have seen VCP....and yes, the card is rare.
Yes it is very rare even the Ty Cobb back has more. Rob

[quote name="Bigb13" post=1392239]Yes it is very rare even the Ty Cobb back has more. Rob[/QUOTE]

There are 100+ rarer cards than the Red Cobb with the Lenox back -- rarity certainly doesn't correlate directly to value. 

The only downside to putting it up for auction is the lack of control you have. Unless you plan on being a JC, you'll have to live with the result. You may want to keep trying for the best offer as the sale of the card means a lot to you.

[quote name="calvindog" post=1392242]There are 100+ rarer cards than the Red Cobb with the Lenox back -- rarity certainly doesn't correlate directly to value. 

The only downside to putting it up for auction is the lack of control you have. Unless you plan on being a JC, you'll have to live with the result. You may want to keep trying for the best offer as the sale of the card means a lot to you.[/QUOTE]

True. However, a couple of auction houses have stated reserves which does stifle bidding but gives a certain amount of control to the consignor.

Here's one example that sold in 2009 SGC 50

[url]http://www.goodwinandco.com/1909-11-lenox-t206-ty-cobb-portrait,-red-backgroun-lot6687.aspx[/url]
Nice example but that was six years ago.
T206.org values it at about $4,100. I'm sure the back adds some though regardless of what t206.org says.

[quote name="Bigb13" post=1392256]Nice example but that was six years ago.[/QUOTE]

That 50 is spectacular. Granted it was six years ago but it's a really nice 50. If someone somehow offers you 25K I'd jump on it.

[quote name="calvindog" post=1392268]That 50 is spectacular. Granted it was six years ago but it's a really nice 50. If someone somehow offers you 25K I'd jump on it.[/QUOTE]

He said he putting it for auction and I asked him to let us know where it is...it not going to sell here as looks like net54 to small a sample for him to get the price he wants or believes would be a good price...I wonder what the biggest sale ever was on net54 b/s/t  at least asking price was that was realistic...    100k?
I will put it away until I decide what auction house to use. Rob
Bump one last time for the hell of it

[quote name="1952boyntoncollector" post=1392297] .I wonder what the biggest sale ever was on net54 b/s/t  at least asking price was that was realistic...    100k?[/QUOTE]

I sold a card for about 52k on the BST, in auction style :)......several years ago. I am not sure there has been a bigger sale, there could have been, I just don't know.
What card was that Leon?

[quote name="Jobu" post=1396869]What card was that Leon?[/QUOTE]

N167 Buck Ewing if I remember correctly....it was definitely a HOF'er N167 and I think it was him....but it's been 6+ yrs. ....so not sure I would swear on the player...

ps....my memory served me ok... except it was 55k and not 52k......

[url]http://www.net54baseball.com/showthread.php?t=68505&highlight=n167+auction[/url]
I may go with Net54 auction not sure yet

Well, we all should get some idea of this card's current value, give or take (this one is a grade higher, but we can adjust after the fact)...

[url]http://bid.robertedwardauctions.com/bidplace.aspx?itemid=33727[/url]

[quote name="CW" post=1397323]Well, we all should get some idea of this card's current value, give or take (this one is a grade higher, but we can adjust after the fact)...

[url]http://bid.robertedwardauctions.com/bidplace.aspx?itemid=33727[/url][/QUOTE]

How did this one grade a PSA 3 with that big crease ?
That's what I was thinking SGC I think would have given it a 2 good I my opinion

[quote name="Bigb13" post=1397548]That's what I was thinking SGC I think would have given it a 2 good I my opinion[/QUOTE]

No offense, but that card is considerably cleaner than yours so I can't imagine it grading SGC 30.

[quote name="Sean" post=1397328]How did this one grade a PSA 3 with that big crease ?[/QUOTE]

Because it's PSA lol.

[quote name="Gobucsmagic74" post=1397569]No offense, but that card is considerably cleaner than yours so I can't imagine it grading SGC 30.[/QUOTE]

Who was talking about my card?
Just commenting on the fact that you believe the referenced PSA 3 card would have been graded Good by SGC when it looks considerably nicer than your card which has been graded SGC 30.
SGC is a lot stricter than PSA
I'm with Dan. The REA Cobb is a beauty and very clean compared to the SGC 30. I think the grades are fair.
people bashing psa because it's cool?  that's a psa 3 now and would've been a 3 in 2005.  would go as far as that deserves a 3 more than the OP's card deserving of a 30 from SGC.
This is a BST thread not a bashing thread at least I have one more than the bashing people have.

[quote name="Bigb13" post=1397798]This is a BST thread not a bashing thread at least I have one more than the bashing people have.[/QUOTE]

I'm sorry if you felt like I was bashing your card in any way, its a frickin' amazing card man! Did not intend to offend you in any way...I wish I owned that one.
